SENT.plain: Behcet's disease in a 27-year-old male is described
The patient presented fever, dyspnea and hemoptysis
A chest X-ray revealed right hilar enlargement
Exploratory thoracotomy revealed a pulsating mass in the superior lobar artery consistent with aneurysm
Pulmonary biopsy confirmed necrotizing vasculitis of the tissue consistent with Behcet's disease
Pulmonary arteriography showed and aneurysmatic enlargement of the bifurcation between the mid and righ inferior lobar arteries, with thrombosis of the upper right and lower left lobar arteries
Resolution of symptoms was achieved through treatment with corticoids and azathioprine
